topic.title: Using Mac OS X installer
topic.shortdesc: How to install the FusionInventory agent using Mac OS X installer.

body.p: The FusionInventory project provides two Mac OS X packages: one for powerpc computers and the other for Intel macs.

The package is a .pkg file designed for silent installation. The agent configuration needs to be done prior to installation, by going into the package and editing the Content\Resources\agent.cfg file.
By default, the agent runs as a daemon, and stores its files in /opt/fusioninventory-agent.
Please note that the FusionInventory agent is not a Mac OS X application, and as such is invisible for users.
Once configured, the agent can be deployed either manually (by double clicking on the .pkg file) or automatically using tools like Apple Remote Desktop.
